James

Langford

Full Stack Web Developer

About

Since I was young, figuring out how things work has been one of my primary interests. Later in life, I would solve problems using calculus and advanced mathematics and also create works of original music.

In my constant journey of learning new concepts of which I thoroughly enjoy, I have found web development to be exciting. It's awesome to be able to create things that are useful and to be able to share them with the world.

Projects

E-Commerce site, built using AngularJS 1.5 components, Node, and SQL. Users are able to order products with payments processed through stripe, and login is done locally using passport.js

Built using AngularJS, Node, and uses the Vimeo's developer API. Users are able to search for and upload videos, and post comments on videos. These changes are then reflected on their Vimeo Account.

Built using AngularJS, Node, & SQL. Displays information about the planets in our solar system by clicking on the planet images. Data is displayed sequentially by using the $timeout service in AngularJS.

Built using AngularJS & Node. Uses Axios in the backend to fetch data from an API containing arrays of coordinate data. Uses Google maps API to plot those points on an interactive map.

Built with AngularJS. Uses third-party API for currency exchange rates. Contains useful tools: currency converter, calculator, stopwatch, and timer.

Built using React and Node. Uses a proxy so the backend can communicate with the front-end. Uses Axios to make http requests to the Youtube API so users can search for videos.

Github

Built using ReactJS & Node. This is an app for start-ups to send out survey emails to clients for receiving feedback. Authentication is done through passport.js. Payments are accepted using Stripe.

Built using ReactJS & Node. Retrieves data from the Open Maps API to display weather data from any city searched for. Uses Redux for managing state and Axios for API calls in the backend and fontend.
